explains: n. 直觉，预感；肉峰；厚片，大块
wordGroup: have a hunch that [口语]总感到，总怀疑

sentences.en: I had a hunch (that) you'd be back.
It seemed that the doctor's hunch had been right.
sentences.cn: 看起来医生的直觉是对的。

sentences.en: Every hunch led to a blind alley and every hypothesis to a dead end.
sentences.cn: 每一次直觉都是死路一条，每一次假设都是死胡同。
